Subject: RE: RE: [cantera] question about freely propagating flame in phyton
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=184860759; y=KlLpGooK42huaXBRDBUWuViBzDgqji6f8CgroQ-i1geQcsA

Sven,

The energy equation must be enabled in order to compute laminar flame
speeds.  Typically the energy equation is turned off initially in order to
get a better initial guess for the species profiles.  Once this is done, the
engergy equation is turned on and the flame is solved again, as in this
example (from ./Cantera/python/examples/flames/adiabatic_flame.py).  The
energy equation is necessary.  Without it, the initial temperature profile
is fixed and doesn't change.  With it, the effects of heat conduction, heat
release, heat convection, etc are all accounted for.



f = FreeFlame(gas = gas, grid = initial_grid, tfix = 600.0)

# set the upstream properties
f.inlet.set(mole_fractions = comp, temperature = tin)

f.set(tol = tol_ss, tol_time = tol_ts)
f.showSolution()

f.set(energy = 'off')
f.setRefineCriteria(ratio = 10.0, slope = 1, curve = 1)
f.setMaxJacAge(50, 50)
f.setTimeStep(1.0e-5, [1, 2, 5, 10, 20])

f.solve(loglevel, refine_grid)
f.save('ch4_adiabatic.xml','no_energy',
       'solution with the energy equation disabled')

f.set(energy = 'on')
f.setRefineCriteria(ratio = 3.0, slope = 0.1, curve = 0.2)
f.solve(loglevel, refine_grid)







-----Original Message-----
From: cantera@yahoogroups.com [mailto:cantera@yahoogroups.com]On Behalf
Of Sven Jerzembeck
Sent: Friday, June 24, 2005 8:23 AM
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Ant: RE: [cantera] question about freely propagating flame in
phyton


Thanks for the answer Karl,
but there is one thing left I dont understand. What
does mean solution with energy equation is enabled or
disabled.
I cannot understand what does this mean. If I am
running my calculations with disabled mode it works
fine. If I try it with enabled mode it doesnt work
well. But what does this mean from the physics point
of view?
Thanks for an answer in advance

Sven


--- Karl Meredith <kvm@...> schrieb:


---------------------------------

Sven,

Mdot is used as an initial guess for the flowfield.
The actual mdot is part
of the solution.  Once the initial temperature guess
has been specified, the
user needs to choose a temperature at a location to
hold constant.  This is
done by:

      flame.setFixedTemperature(900.0);

Then the user needs to specify that this flame is
adiabatic

      flame.setAdiabaticFlame();

Once this is done then the solution can be obtained by
running:

      flame.solve(loglevel=1,refine_grid);

Karl



-----Original Message-----
From: cantera@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:cantera@yahoogroups.com]On Behalf
Of cantera_user
Sent: Wednesday, June 22, 2005 11:25 AM
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [cantera] question about freely propagating
flame in phyton


Hello guys,
can anyone give a brief description on how the new
freely propagating
flame tools works, please? In the beginning you have
to choose mdot e.
g. but it is not used in the further routines anymore.
Can anyone
please explain shortly how it works, and what would be
the best method
to use. I would really like to calculate some flame
speeds for n-
heptane.
Thanks in advance for an answer

Sven
